DOC.brief_summary: The aim current study compare effect three ready-to-eat mixed meal , high fiber content low glycemic index , postprandial glycemic insulinemic response patient Type 2 diabetes mellitus ( T2DM ) .
DOC.brief_title: Post-prandial Glucose Insulin Levels Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Patients After Consumption Ready-to-eat Mixed Meals
DOC.detailed_description: The current study follow prospective , three-way , cross-over design . Twenty four patient T2DM consume three ready-to-eat mixed meal , i.e . `` wild green pie '' ( meal 1 ) , `` chicken burger boil vegetable '' ( meal 2 ) `` vegetable moussaka '' ( meal 3 ) oral glucose load , provide 50g carbohydrate . Venous blood collect 0 , 30 , 60 , 90 120 minute postprandial serum glucose insulin measurement . The test meal consume study participant 8:30 9:00 within 10-15 minute researcher 's supervision , follow collection fast blood sample . No parallel fluid intake allow . The portion size case one three test meal adjust contain 50g carbohydrate . However , three test meal considerably differentiate among respect content calorie remain macronutrients .
DOC.criteria: Subjects eligible 4575 year age noninsulindependent T2DM elapse time since diagnosis 3 year Body Mass Index ( BMI ) value high 20 kg/m2 HbA1c level 6.5 11 % insulindependent T2DM cardiovascular ( i.e . coronary heart disease , stroke etc . ) liver and/or renal disease
